Iterates through the dataset, extracting relevant triples (subject, predicate, object) from each sentence based on the topic terms associated with the document.\\n4. Stores the extracted triples in the dataset and saves the updated dataset to a new file.\\n\\nThe purpose of this script is to extract structured knowledge in the form of triples from a corpus of text data, which can be useful for various natural language processing tasks such as question answering, knowledge graph construction, and information extraction.\",\"/pipeline/10_explain.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It is an implementation of an algorithm for topic explanation that includes the following functions:\\n\\n`remove_numbers`: Removes numbers from a given text.\\n`remove_dbpedia_categories`: Removes the DBpedia category from a given string.\\n`return_url_element`: Extracts the last element from a URL-like string.\\n`filter_and_extract_relevant_triples`: Filters and extracts relevant triples from a dataset, expanding the vocabulary using spaCy similarity.\\n`perform_hierarchical_clustering`: Performs hierarchical clustering on the expanded vocabulary and computes the silhouette score.\\n`generate_explanations_with_Qwen2.5`: Generates explanations for the clusters using the Qwen-2.5 model.\\n`evaluate_explanations_with_mT5`: Evaluates the generated explanations using the mT5 model.\\n`summarize_results`: Writes a summary of the results to a file.\\n\\nThe file implements a pipeline for topic explanation, including processing of triples, vocabulary expansion, hierarchical clustering, generation of explanations using Qwen-2.5, and evaluation of the explanations using mT5.\",\"/utils/types.py\":\"`CaseInsensitiveDict`: A dictionary that is case-insensitive for keys.\\n\\n`CaseInsensitiveSet`: A set that is case-insensitive for its elements.\\n\\n`StringCaseInsensitiveSet`: A set that preserves the case of its elements but tests for containment by case-folded value.\\n\\n`_fold`: A static method that folds the case of a given value.\\n\\n`__getitem__`: A method that retrieves the value associated with a given key in the `CaseInsensitiveDict`.\\n\\n`__setitem__`: A method that sets the value associated with a given key in the `CaseInsensitiveDict`.\\n\\n`__delitem__`: A method that deletes the item associated with a given key in the `CaseInsensitiveDict`.\\n\\n`__iter__`: A method that returns an iterator over the keys in the `CaseInsensitiveDict`.\\n\\n`__len__`: A method that returns the length of the `CaseInsensitiveDict`.\\n\\n`items`: A method that returns an iterator over the key-value pairs in the `CaseInsensitiveDict`.\\n\\n`keys`: A method that returns an iterator over the keys in the `CaseInsensitiveDict`.\\n\\n`values`: A method that returns an iterator over the values in the `CaseInsensitiveDict`.\\n\\n`get`: A method that retrieves the value associated with a given key in the `CaseInsensitiveDict`, with a default value if the key is not found.\\n\\n`__contains__`: A method that checks if a given item is in the `CaseInsensitiveSet`.\\n\\n`add`: A method that adds a given item to the `CaseInsensitiveSet`.\\n\\n`discard`: A method that removes a given item from the `CaseInsensitiveSet`.\\n\\n`__ior__`: A method that adds the elements of an iterable to the `StringCaseInsensitiveSet`.\\n\\n`update`: A method that adds the elements of an iterable to the `StringCaseInsensitiveSet`.\\n\\n`isdisjoint`: A method that checks if two `StringCaseInsensitiveSet`s have a null intersection.\\n\\n`intersection`: A method that returns the intersection of two `StringCaseInsensitiveSet`s.\\n\\n`issuperset`: A method that checks if one `StringCaseInsensitiveSet` is a superset of another.\\n\\n`__eq__`: A method that checks if two `StringCaseInsensitiveSet`s are equal.\",\"/pipeline/05_tfidf.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it performs the following tasks:\\n\\n1. Loads a DataFrame with topic information and top terms by topic from pickle files.\\n2. Reconstructs the filtered text from the token data in the DataFrame.\\n3. Computes the global TF-IDF matrix and adds the top 15 TF-IDF terms for each document to the DataFrame.\\n4. Adds the top terms by topic to the DataFrame.\\n5. Saves the TF-IDF matrix and the preprocessed DataFrame to pickle files.\\n\\nThe main purpose of this script is to preprocess text data, compute TF-IDF features, and enrich the data with topic-related information, which can be used for downstream tasks.\",\"/pykeen_transe_model/metadata.json\":\"This file appears to be empty and does not contain any classes or functions. Without any content, it is not possible to provide a meaningful summary of the file\\u0027s purpose.\",\"/utils/utils.py\":\"This file is a Python script that demonstrates how to use the SPARQLWrapper library to query the DBpedia SPARQL endpoint and retrieve a set of five random triples (subject, predicate, object).\\n\\n`SPARQLWrapper`: A library that provides a simple interface for querying SPARQL endpoints and retrieving the results.\\n\\n`SPARQLWrapper.SPARQLWrapper`: A class that represents a SPARQL endpoint and provides methods for executing queries and retrieving the results.\\n\\n`SPARQLWrapper.JSON`: A format for the returned results, in this case, JSON.\",\"/preprocessing/preproc_module.py\":\"This file contains a set of classes and functions for text analysis and ontology management.\\n\\n`TextAnalyzer`: A class that provides methods for cleaning and processing text, including removing special lines, stripping formatting, and checking if a word is present in a given text.\\n\\n`SemanticAnalyzer`: A subclass of `TextAnalyzer` that uses the Spotlight API to annotate text with semantic information, including entity URIs and types.\\n\\n`OntoManager`: A class that manages the loading and querying of ontologies, including DBpedia and SUMO, and provides methods for retrieving information about concepts and their relationships.\\n\\n`simplificar_entidades`: A function that simplifies the representation of entities by extracting the surface form, URI, and types.\\n\\n`limpiar_entidades`: A function that takes a series of entities and returns a dictionary of simplified entity representations.\\n\\n`completar_tipos_faltantes`: A function that takes a dictionary of entity representations and an `OntoManager` instance, and fills in any missing types by querying the ontologies.\\n\\n`fetch_all_types`: A function that is not included in the provided code, but is mentioned as being used by `completar_tipos_faltantes`.\",\"/pipeline/11_coevaluate.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it is a Python script that performs the following tasks:\\n\\n1. Imports various libraries and modules for data processing, clustering, and text generation.\\n2. Sets up the output directory and the ID of the topic to be processed.\\n3. Loads the clustering results from a file and generates a summary text file that describes the generated topics for the specified topic ID.\\n4. Prints a message indicating that the pipeline has been completed and the output is available in the specified directory.\",\"/pipeline/02_topic_modeling.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`main()`: This function performs preprocessing of text data, trains an LDA (Latent Dirichlet Allocation) topic model, evaluates the model using coherence, and saves the results.\\n\\n`compute_coherence_values()`: This function trains LDA models with different combinations of hyperparameters (number of topics, alpha, and beta) and computes the coherence score for each model.\\n\\nIn summary, this file is a script that automates the process of training and evaluating an LDA topic model on a text corpus, and saves the results for further analysis.\",\"/output/clusters.json\":\"This file appears to be a JSON object containing information about a clustering analysis. It does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it provides the following information:\\n\\n`best_k`: The optimal number of clusters, which is 2 in this case.\\n\\n`global_sil`: The global silhouette score, which is a measure of the quality of the clustering, with a value of 0.24699459079845745.\\n\\n`clusters`: An object containing the two clusters, where the keys are the cluster indices (0 and 1) and the values are lists of words belonging to each cluster.\\n\\nIn summary, this file presents the results of a clustering analysis, including the optimal number of clusters, the overall clustering quality, and the specific words assigned to each cluster.\",\"/pipeline/explainations_topoc.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it is an implementation of an algorithm for topic explanation, which includes the following steps:\\n\\n1. Filtering and extracting relevant triples from a dataset.\\n2. Expanding the vocabulary using spaCy similarity.\\n3. Performing hierarchical clustering on the terms and selecting the optimal number of clusters.\\n4. Generating explanations for the clusters using the Qwen-2.5 model.\\n5. Evaluating the generated explanations using the mT5 model.\\n6. Generating a summary text file with the results.\\n\\nThe file also includes various configuration settings and utility functions to support the main algorithm.\",\"/olds/3_generacion_tripletas_simplificado.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`devolver_tripletas`: Extracts triples from a given sentence and returns a list of triples.\\n\\n`devolver_pos`: Returns a dictionary of part-of-speech tags for each word in a given sentence.\\n\\n`transformar`: Applies the `anotar` function to each row of a DataFrame.\\n\\n`anota_texto`: Annotates a given text using the CoreNLPClient.\\n\\n`anotar`: Annotates a row of a DataFrame, extracting triples and other information.\\n\\nThe file also imports and reloads the `semantic_oboe` module, and uses the `TripletGenerator` and `TripletManager` classes from the `triplet_manager_lib` module. The main functionality of the file is to process a DataFrame of text data, extract triples from the text, and save the results to a CSV file.\",\"/pykeen_transe_model/results.json\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It appears to be a JSON document that contains information about the losses and metrics of a machine learning model. The document includes the following information:\\n\\n1. `losses`: A list of loss values for the model during training.\\n2. `metrics`: An object that contains various performance metrics for the model, including optimistic, pessimistic, and realistic versions of the metrics. The metrics include adjusted arithmetic mean rank, adjusted geometric mean rank index, adjusted hits at k, adjusted inverse harmonic mean rank, arithmetic mean rank, geometric mean rank, harmonic mean rank, hits at 1, hits at 3, hits at 5, hits at 10, inverse arithmetic mean rank, inverse geometric mean rank, inverse harmonic mean rank, inverse median rank, median absolute deviation, median rank, standard deviation, variance, z-scores for various metrics, and more.\\n3. `times`: An object that contains the evaluation and training times for the model.\",\"/main.py\":\"This file is a Python script that fine-tunes a pre-trained language model (TinyLlama-1.1B-Chat-v1.0) using the PEFT (Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning) library and the Hugging Face Transformers library. The script loads the pre-trained model and tokenizer, and then loads a dataset from a JSON file for fine-tuning. The script does not define any classes or functions, but rather performs the following tasks:\\n\\n1. Imports the necessary libraries and modules.\\n2. Defines the model ID, data path, and output model path.\\n3. Loads the pre-trained model and tokenizer.\\n4. Loads the dataset from a JSON file.\\n5. Prints the available fields in the dataset.\",\"/utils/pos_manager_lib.py\":\"This file contains two classes and several functions:\\n\\n`PosManager`: A class that manages part-of-speech (POS) tagging and normalization of text.\\n\\n`PredicateManager`: A class that extends `PosManager` and provides methods for handling predicates in text.\\n\\n`son_palabras_equivalentes`: Checks if two tokens are equivalent based on their lemmas.\\n\\n`buscar_pos_palabra`: Finds the part-of-speech tag for a given word.\\n\\n`buscar_pos`: Finds the part-of-speech tags for a given set of words.\\n\\n`es_frase_valida`: Checks if a given set of part-of-speech tags represents a valid sentence.\\n\\n`resolve_contractions`: Resolves common English contractions in a given text.\\n\\n`normalizar_frase`: Normalizes a given text by removing non-alphanumeric characters and resolving contractions.\\n\\n`normalizar_token`: Normalizes a given token by removing non-alphanumeric characters.\\n\\n`devolver_pos_palabras`: Returns a dictionary of part-of-speech tags for the words in a given predicate.\\n\\n`devolver_sin_modal`: Removes modal verbs from a given predicate.\\n\\n`devolver_sin_adverbio`: Removes adverbs from a given predicate.\\n\\n`es_predicado_valido`: Checks if a given predicate is valid based on its part-of-speech tags.\\n\\n`es_sujeto_valido`: Checks if a given predicate contains a valid subject based on its part-of-speech tags.\\n\\n`es_objeto_valido`: Checks if a given predicate contains a valid object based on its part-of-speech tags.\\n\\n`buscar_indice_pos_palabra`: Finds the index of a given word in a predicate based on its part-of-speech tag.\\n\\n`buscar_patron_VNI`: Checks if a given predicate follows the \\\"Verb-Noun-Preposition\\\" pattern.\\n\\n`patron_verbo_preposicion`: Checks if a given predicate follows the \\\"Verb-Preposition\\\" pattern.\\n\\n`normalizar_predicado`: Normalizes a given predicate by removing certain words (e.g., modal verbs, \\\"have\\\", \\\"be\\\").\\n\\n`devolver_verbo_predicado_normalizado`: Returns the normalized form of a given predicate, optionally with the verb lemmatized.\",\"/output/evaluations.json\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It appears to be a JSON-formatted document that contains two entries, each with an \\\"error\\\" field that provides an example of an evaluation with justification. The evaluation includes scores for \\\"coherencia\\\", \\\"relevancia\\\", and \\\"cobertura\\\", along with a justification text. The document also mentions some key terms, such as \\\"walkman\\\", \\\"deaf\\\", and \\\"connection\\\".\",\"/output/explanations.json\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It appears to be a JSON document that describes the characteristics of two different clusters or groups of terms. The first cluster is related to music, sound, and entertainment, while the second cluster is related to technology, innovation, and concepts like connection, transmission, and communication.\",\"/pipeline/08_classify_triplets.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it performs the following tasks:\\n\\n1. Loads data from various files, including triples, entity embeddings, relation embeddings, and TF-IDF preprocessed data.\\n2. Constructs feature vectors by combining the embeddings and TF-IDF information for each triple.\\n3. Trains a Random Forest Classifier model on the labeled data, evaluates its performance, and saves the trained model.\\n4. Classifies all the triples in the dataset using the trained model and adds a \\\"plausibility\\\" column to the original dataframe, which is then saved to a new file.\\n\\nThe purpose of this script is to build a machine learning model to classify triples as either valid or noise, and then apply the model to a larger dataset to identify plausible triples.\",\"/preprocessing/triplet_extraction (1).py\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`devolver_pos`: Returns a dictionary mapping each token in a sentence to its part-of-speech tag.\\n\\n`devolver_tripletas`: Extracts triplets (subject, relation, object) from a given sentence using the OpenIE annotator and additional custom rules.\\n\\n`anotar_fila`: Processes a row of data, annotating the text with triplets and returning the results.\\n\\nThe file also initializes a CoreNLPClient for the OpenIE annotator and imports necessary libraries. The overall purpose of the file is to extract triplets from text data using a combination of the OpenIE annotator and custom rules.\",\"/preprocessing/preprocessing.py\":\"This file is a Python script that performs a sequential preprocessing pipeline on a set of input data files. The pipeline includes the following steps:\\n\\n1. Resolving coreferences using spaCy and coreferee.\\n2. Cleaning and normalizing the text using a TextAnalyzer.\\n3. Recognizing entities using Spotlight.\\n4. Enriching and normalizing the entities using an OntoManager.\\n\\nThe script reads the configuration from a JSON file, processes the input files sequentially, and saves the preprocessed data to output files. It also measures the processing time for each job and estimates the total processing time.\\n\\nThe file contains the following functions:\\n\\n`resolve_corefs`: Resolves coreferences in the input text using the spaCy and coreferee libraries.\\n`init_spacy`: Initializes the spaCy pipeline with the coreferee component.\\n`identify_dbpedia_entities`: Identifies DBpedia entities in the input text using the Spotlight API.\\n`partition_preprocess`: Applies the entire preprocessing pipeline to a DataFrame.\\n`main`: The main function that orchestrates the preprocessing pipeline.\",\"/pipeline/11_explain_evaluate.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it is an implementation of an algorithm for topic explanation that includes the following steps:\\n\\n1. Filtering and extracting relevant triples from a dataset, expanding the vocabulary using spaCy similarity, and performing hierarchical clustering with silhouette analysis to determine the optimal number of clusters.\\n2. Generating explanations for each cluster using the Qwen-2.5 language model and evaluating the explanations using the mT5 model.\\n3. Saving the cluster information, explanations, and evaluations to output files.\\n\\nThe file also includes various helper functions and configuration settings.\",\"/olds/03_triplet_extraction.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it is a script that performs the following tasks:\\n\\n1. Loads a pre-trained language model and tokenizer from a specified path.\\n2. Reads a preprocessed dataset from a file.\\n3. Iterates through the dataset, extracting relevant triples (subject, predicate, object) from each sentence based on the topic terms associated with the document.\\n4. Stores the extracted triples in the dataset and saves the updated dataset to a new file.\\n\\nThe purpose of this script is to extract structured knowledge in the form of triples from a corpus of text data, which can be useful for various natural language processing tasks such as question answering, knowledge graph construction, and information extraction.\",\"/olds/1_1_1_dbpedia_tipos.py\":\"This file contains a series of classes and functions that are used to process and analyze text data, specifically from the BBC corpus. Here is a summary of the classes and functions:\\n\\n`TextAnalyzer`: A class that provides methods for preprocessing and tokenizing text data.\\n\\n`SemanticAnalyzer`: A subclass of `TextAnalyzer` that uses the Spotlight API to annotate text with DBpedia entities.\\n\\n`OntoManager`: A class that manages the interaction with DBpedia and SUMO ontologies, providing methods to retrieve semantic information about terms.\\n\\n`simplificar_entidades`: A function that simplifies the representation of DBpedia entities in the corpus.\\n\\n`devolver_entidades_limpias_df`: A function that applies the `simplificar_entidades` function to the `entidades_dbpedia` column of the corpus dataframe.\\n\\n`devolver_nuevos_tipos`: A function that retrieves the DBpedia types for the entities in the corpus and updates the `entidades_dbpedia_simplificadas` column.\\n\\nThe file also includes code to load the BBC corpus, the DBpedia and SUMO ontologies, and to save the processed corpus to a file.\",\"/config/config.json\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It appears to be a configuration file that specifies the input and output paths for preprocessing two different datasets: the BBC dataset and another corpus (possibly from Amazon). The configuration file sets the paths for the raw corpus input, the preprocessed output, and the preprocessing steps to be performed on each dataset.\",\"/pipeline/09_new_triplets_relations.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it performs the following tasks:\\n\\n1. Imports necessary libraries and sets up file paths for data and model.\\n2. Loads a pre-trained language model and tokenizer.\\n3. Reads in a dataset of triples and cluster labels.\\n4. Infers new triples between entities that share URIs or synonyms but belong to different clusters.\\n5. Generates explanations for the inferred triples using the language model.\\n6. Saves the inferred triples and their explanations to a file.\\n\\nThe main purpose of this script is to automatically generate explanations for inferred relationships between entities in a knowledge graph, based on shared URIs or synonyms across different clusters.\",\"/setup.py\":\"This file is a setup.py file for a Python package called \\\"semantic_oboe\\\". It sets up the package metadata, including the name, version, description, long description, maintainer, and classifiers. The file also includes functions to retrieve the package version and find the packages to include in the distribution. Overall, this file is used to package and distribute the \\\"semantic_oboe\\\" Python package.\\n\\n`get_version`: A function that retrieves the version of the package from the __init__.py file.\",\"/pipeline/07_embedd_cluster.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it performs the following tasks:\\n\\n1. Loads entity embeddings from a file and performs hierarchical clustering using the Ward method.\\n2. Selects the optimal number of clusters by evaluating the silhouette score for different values of k (number of clusters).\\n3. Saves the cluster labels to a file using the optimal number of clusters.\\n\\nThe file is used to cluster entities based on their embeddings and save the resulting cluster labels for further use.\",\"/pipeline/adapted_corrected_explain.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It is an implementation of an algorithm for topic explanation, which includes the following functions:\\n\\n`remove_numbers`: Removes numbers from a given text.\\n`remove_dbpedia_categories`: Removes the DBpedia category from a given string.\\n`return_url_element`: Extracts the last element from a URL-like string.\\n`filter_and_extract_relevant_triples`: Filters and extracts relevant triples from a dataset, and processes the terms to extract information about them.\\n`expand_vocabulary_with_spacy`: Expands the vocabulary by finding similar terms using spaCy.\\n`perform_hierarchical_clustering`: Performs hierarchical clustering on the terms and determines the optimal number of clusters using silhouette score.\\n`generate_explanations_with_qwen`: Generates explanations for each cluster using the Qwen-2.5 model.\\n`evaluate_explanations_with_mt5`: Evaluates the generated explanations using the mT5 model.\\n`summarize_results`: Writes a summary of the results to a file.\\n\\nThe file also includes some configuration variables and imports necessary libraries and modules.\",\"/pipeline/06_kge_emb.py\":\"This file is a Python script that performs knowledge graph embedding (KGE) using the PyKEEN library and then uses the learned embeddings for a classification task.\\n\\n`TriplesFactory`: A class that represents a set of triples (subject, relation, object) and provides methods for working with them.\\n\\n`get_embedding`: A function that retrieves the embedding vector for a given entity.\\n\\nThe script performs the following steps:\\n\\n1. Loads the triples data and creates a `TriplesFactory` object.\\n2. Splits the triples into training and testing sets.\\n3. Trains a TransE KGE model using the PyKEEN pipeline.\\n4. Saves the trained model and loads it.\\n5. Extracts the entity and relation embeddings from the trained model.\\n6. Applies the entity embeddings to the subjects and objects in the triples data to create the feature matrix.\\n7. Performs a train-test split on the feature matrix and labels.\\n8. Trains an XGBoost classifier on the training data and evaluates its performance on the test data.\",\"/pipeline/evaluate_triplets_with_roberta.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`RobertaTokenizer.from_pretrained`: Loads a pre-trained RoBERTa tokenizer.\\n\\n`RobertaForSequenceClassification.from_pretrained`: Loads a pre-trained RoBERTa model for sequence classification.\\n\\n`is_triplet_valid`: Classifies whether a given triplet (subject, predicate, object) is valid in the context of a given text, using the pre-trained RoBERTa model.\\n\\nThe file demonstrates how to use a pre-trained RoBERTa model to classify the validity of a given triplet in the context of a text.\",\"/utils/triplet_manager_lib.py\":\"This file contains the implementation of the `Tripleta` class and the `TripletGenerator` and `TripletManager` classes, which are used for extracting and managing triples (subject-predicate-object) from text.\\n\\n`Tripleta`: A class that represents a triple, with properties for the subject, relation, and object, and methods for comparing and manipulating triples.\\n\\n`TripletGenerator`: A class that generates basic triples from text using Stanford NLP tools.\\n\\n`TripletManager`: A class that manages the extraction, normalization, and consolidation of triples from text, using the `Tripleta` class and the `TripletGenerator`.\\n\\nThe file also includes several helper functions for working with triples, such as `contenidoEn`, `sustituirPorNer`, `es_candidata`, `normalizar_tripleta`, `consolidar_tripletas`, and `devolver_listado_definitivo`.\",\"/pipeline/03_triplet_gen .py\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`devolver_tripletas`: Extracts triples from a given sentence using the OpenIE annotator and performs additional processing to generate more triples.\\n\\n`devolver_pos`: Returns a dictionary of part-of-speech tags for each word in a given sentence.\\n\\n`transformar`: Applies the `anotar` function to each row of a DataFrame.\\n\\n`anota_texto`: Annotates a given text using the CoreNLPClient.\\n\\n`anotar`: Annotates a row of a DataFrame, extracting triples and performing additional processing.\\n\\nThe file also imports and uses several modules, including `stanza`, `joblib`, `dask.dataframe`, and custom modules from the `semantic_oboe` package. The main purpose of the file is to process a DataFrame of text data, extract semantic triples, and save the results to a CSV file.\",\"/olds/03_kge_gen.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it performs the following tasks:\\n\\n1. Loads a pre-trained language model and tokenizer from a specified path.\\n2. Extracts all subject-predicate-object triples from a corpus of text data, using the loaded language model.\\n3. Saves the extracted triples to a new file.\\n\\nThe file uses the `transformers` library to load the language model and tokenizer, and the `pandas` library to read and write the data.\",\"/olds/explainations_topoc.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it is an implementation of a topic explanation algorithm that processes triples, expands vocabulary, performs hierarchical clustering using spaCy for similarity, generates explanations with Qwen-2.5, and evaluates the results with mT5. The file also includes various utility functions and configurations.\",\"/pipeline/04_expand_concept_sem.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`dbpedia_spotlight`: This function takes an entity as input and returns the corresponding DBpedia URI, if available.\\n\\n`wordnet_synsets`: This function takes an entity as input and returns its WordNet definition and synonyms.\\n\\nThe file reads a dataset of triples (subject, relation, object) from a pickle file, expands each triple with the corresponding DBpedia URI and WordNet information, and saves the expanded dataset to a new pickle file.\",\"/README.md\":\"There are no classes or functions in the provided document. Saves the preprocessed data, including the text, sentences, and TF-IDF top terms, to a pickle file.\\n\\nThe overall purpose of this script is to preprocess a corpus of text data, extract relevant features using TF-IDF, and save the preprocessed data for further analysis or modeling.\",\"/utils/__init__.py\":\"There are no classes or functions in the provided file.
